Main API endpoint used to generate GIFs

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: The video URL you would like to generate a GIF from

required_parameters.name: start
required_parameters.description: The starting time (in seconds) of your GIF

required_parameters.name: end
required_parameters.description: The ending time (in seconds) of your GIF

optional_parameters.name: duration
optional_parameters.description: The duration (in seconds) of your GIF

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: resize the GIF to the dimensions of your choice (accepts width and height in pixels) (Default: 300x200)

optional_parameters.name: crop
optional_parameters.description: Crop the GIF to the size of your choice (accepts width and height in pixels)

optional_parameters.name: fps
optional_parameters.description: specify a GIF quality (Frames per Second) of your choice (Default: 15)

optional_parameters.name: trailer
optional_parameters.description: Set to "1" to create default trailer, or specify custom trailer parameters

api_list.api_description:
From this endpoint you can generate a single api key.

It will be used to link all the qr code created, and allow any changes.

Important: Keep in mind that once generated, it is necessary that you store this key well, since it is not possible to recover it, and without it, you do not have access to change any of your QR Codes.
From this endpoint is to get the information of a specific registered qr code, related to the respective api key
From this endpoint is to list all registered qr codes, related to their api key.

For example:
http://owatheowais.pythonanywhere.com//qr?url=https://www.google.com

The default browser behavior is to cache responses that return from the same endpoint.
If your images are all returning the same, pass this param with ANY value to ensure you bypass this default behaviour and get random images for every request.

optional_parameters.name: name
optional_parameters.description: Specify the name for the avatar. Only the first character of this parameter will be shown in the avatar.

optional_parameters.name: bg-color
optional_parameters.description:
Specify a HEX CODE color for the background of the avatar. 
Do not include the # of the hex code as it will be ignored on api request.

optional_parameters.name: text-color
optional_parameters.description:
Specify a HEX CODE color for the letter on the avatar. 
Do not include the # of the hex code as it will be ignored on api request.

api_list.api_description: Capture screenshot from any URL or Raw HTML. POST method is also available. Please take a look https://restpack.io/screenshot/docs

optional_parameters.name: html
optional_parameters.description:
Raw HTML string of a page that you want to capture. Example:

Test

optional_parameters.name: json
optional_parameters.description: Return a JSON response with the resulting image's URL instead of the image itself. Default: false

optional_parameters.name: mode
optional_parameters.description: Capturing mode. Please see below for details. Default: fullpage Pattern: fullpage | viewport | element

optional_parameters.name: format
optional_parameters.description: Preferred image output format. If you need a raw html string you can pass html as format Default: png Pattern: jpg | png | pdf | html

optional_parameters.name: width
optional_parameters.description: Preferred viewport width in pixels. Default: 1280 Min: 320 Max: 2000

optional_parameters.name: height
optional_parameters.description: Preferred viewport height in pixels. Default: 1024 Min: 160

optional_parameters.name: thumbnail_width
optional_parameters.description: In case you want a thumbnail image, provide a preferred width. Min: 10 Max: 3000

optional_parameters.name: thumbnail_height
optional_parameters.description: Preferred thumbnail height, requires thumbnail_width to be set, unbounded if omitted. Min: 10 Max: 3000

optional_parameters.name: css
optional_parameters.description: Additional CSS string to be injected into the page before render.

optional_parameters.name: js
optional_parameters.description: Additional JS string to be injected into the page before render.

optional_parameters.name: prescroll
optional_parameters.description: Force scrolling the webpage before capture. Might help with dynamic loading assets.

optional_parameters.name: delay
optional_parameters.description: Time in milliseconds to delay capture after page load. Default: 2000 Max: 10000

optional_parameters.name: ttl
optional_parameters.description: Time in milliseconds for the resulting image to be cached for further requests. Default: 1 day Max: 1 week

optional_parameters.name: fresh
optional_parameters.description: Force rendering a new screenshot disregarding the cache status. Default: false

optional_parameters.name: user_agent
optional_parameters.description: Custom user-agent header string for the web request. Default: Chrome Compatible User Agent

optional_parameters.name: accept_language
optional_parameters.description: Custom accept-language header string for the web request.

optional_parameters.name: element_selector
optional_parameters.description: A CSS selector to be used with element rendering mode.

optional_parameters.name: headers
optional_parameters.description: Additional headers seperated with newline Example: X-Test: header\nAccept-Type: html

optional_parameters.name: retina
optional_parameters.description: Generate retina sized screen capture (2x device pixel ratio). Default: false

optional_parameters.name: base64
optional_parameters.description: Serialize response file to base64

optional_parameters.name: access_token
optional_parameters.description: You can provide your token via querystring instead of header.

optional_parameters.name: url
optional_parameters.description: The URL of web page, including the protocol that you want to capture.

Calling the web service involves a simple HTTP GET request. The only two requirements for using PurgoMalum are the "text" parameter on the query string and the request-type name as part of the path in the request

required_parameters.name: text
required_parameters.description: Input text to be processed.

optional_parameters.name: add
optional_parameters.description: A comma separated list of words to be added to the profanity list. Accepts letters, numbers, underscores (_) and commas (,). Accepts up to 10 words (or 200 maximum characters in length). The PurgoMalum filter is case-insensitive, so the case of you entry is not important.

optional_parameters.name: fill_text
optional_parameters.description: Text used to replace any words matching the profanity list. Accepts letters, numbers, underscores (_) tildes (~), exclamation points (!), dashes/hyphens (-), equal signs (=), pipes (|), single quotes ('), double quotes ("), asterisks (*), open and closed curly brackets ({ }), square brackets ([ ]) and parentheses (). Maximum length of 20 characters. When not used, the default is an asterisk (*) fill.

optional_parameters.name: fill_char
optional_parameters.description: Single character used to replace any words matching the profanity list. Fills designated character to length of word replaced. Accepts underscore (_) tilde (~), dash/hyphen (-), equal sign (=), pipe (|) and asterisk (*). When not used, the default is an asterisk (*) fill.

The connection proxy details are `proxy.host` and `proxy.port` from the response fields.
The proxy will allow connections from the same source IP as the one making this API call. Make use of the `whitelist_ip` parameter to allow an additional ip.
Countries can be selected by using the `countries` parameter, otherwise the country is randomly selected. A list of countries is available on *Service Status* endpoint.
The proxy is available for 30 mins.

optional_parameters.name: whitelist_ip
optional_parameters.description:
The proxy that this endpoint returns will allow connections from the source ip that is making this API call.
Additionally, you can allow an extra ip to connect to the proxy by setting this parameter to the ip that you would like to whitelist.
The list of ips that the proxy has whitelisted is returned in the API response.

optional_parameters.name: countries
optional_parameters.description:
List of countries, separate it by comma, that you would like the proxies to be located.
Example: GB,US,PL,RU

A QR code generator API is a tool that enables developers to generate QR codes within their applications. QR codes are two-dimensional barcodes that can be scanned using a smartphone camera and decoded using QR code reader software. The API allows developers to easily integrate QR code generation functionality into their existing applications, such as mobile apps, web apps, and software.

This API can be used to generate QR codes for a variety of purposes, such as:

Contact information: Generate a QR code containing your contact information, such as your phone number or email address.
Links: Create a QR code that links to a website, YouTube video, or other online content.
Payments: Create a QR code for making payments through a mobile wallet or payment app.
Events: Generate a QR code for an event, such as a concert or conference, to provide attendees with all the necessary information.
Coupons: Create a QR code for a coupon or promo code to be redeemed at a physical store or online.
Overall, a QR code generator API is a versatile tool that can help businesses and individuals streamline their processes and improve the user experience for their customers.

api_list.api_description: Conditionally requests user for an input, and returns their input or a predefined message stating no user input is required for answering the query.

required_parameters.name: requires_input
required_parameters.description: A flag to determine if user input is needed (1) or not (0)

optional_parameters.name: input_question
optional_parameters.description: The question to ask the user to gather more information for answering the query

query: I want to explore the Star Wars universe and learn about all the characters. Can you fetch me all the characters with their details? Additionally, I'm curious about the Netflix titles related to Star Wars. Could you search for any titles related to Star Wars and provide me with the details?

api_list.api_description: Get Podcast episodes with Audio, image, description using the username of the podcast.

required_parameters.name: username
required_parameters.description:
The username of the anchor podcase user for example:
https://anchor.fm/**financialfreedomtribe**

api_list.api_description: Check if domain is fronted by CDN provider.
List of support Language
From this endpoint is to list all registered qr codes, related to their api key.
From this endpoint is to get the information of a specific registered qr code, related to the respective api key

From this endpoint you can generate a single api key.

It will be used to link all the qr code created, and allow any changes.

Important: Keep in mind that once generated, it is necessary that you store this key well, since it is not possible to recover it, and without it, you do not have access to change any of your QR Codes.
Conditionally requests user for an input, and returns their input or a predefined message stating no user input is required for answering the query.

required_parameters.name: requires_input
required_parameters.description: A flag to determine if user input is needed (1) or not (0)

optional_parameters.name: input_question
optional_parameters.description: The question to ask the user to gather more information for answering the query

query: I'm starting a new podcast and I need to find a reliable hosting platform. Check the supported languages for the keyword tool and provide me with the list. Also, get the information of a specific registered QR code.
